instNote: ﻿On Sunday, besides the high Mass at 10 o'clock, at which there is an English and a French sermon alternately, there is Mass and a sermon in the German language at 9 o'clock. After Vespers, there is a meeting of the Confraternity of the Rosary.

﻿https://icnewmadrid.com/church-history ; 1833 almanac mentions no name for the church, but the 1860s/70s almanacs mention a St. John. The church site says that said church(es) came after the war. This means that this one in the 1833 almanac is likely the precursor.

courses: ﻿The Mercantile Department embraces Reading, Writing, the English and French Languages, Poetry, Rhetoric, History, Geography, Mythology, Book-Keeping, Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, the use of the Globes, Trigonometry, Mensuration, and Survey-ng. The Classical Department, besides the above specified subjects, comprises the Latin and Greek Languages, Logic, Metaphysics, Moral and Natural Philosophy, and the higher branches of the Mathematics.

courses: ﻿English, Orthography, Reading, Writing, Arithmetic, English and French, Grammar and Composition, Geography, Sacred and Profane History, Ancient and Modern Chronology, Mythology, Poetical Composition, Rhetoric, Philosophy, Chemistry, Astronomy, Use of the Maps and Globes. Also, Music, vocal and instrumental, on the Harp, Piano and Guitar, Painting in water colours and on Velvet, plain and ornamental Needle-work, Tapestry, Lace and Bead work, &c.
